title: The Judge
occurrences: My old guardian, The Judge. The same day we left Italy.
Since I was 15, The Judge has made the decisions. When Dad died ..
- Why do you call him The Judge? - He is a judge.
- A Mr Langton for Judge Cunning. - Who?
Good afternoon. Judge Cunning is away, but his assistant can help.
Verner, Judge Cunning's assistant.
Judge Cunning. You're bankrupt.
Yes I'm crazy!...here you are... The Judge's little love letter.
Judge Cunning?
You should take this story far away and bury it. A High Court judge...
Judge Cunning has swindled me!
"I transfer to Judge Cunning mortgages to the value of 150,000 kronor."
I lie in bed tossing and turning. I dream The Judge is trying to take my doona.
Who'll pay for it...the judge?
Mr Langton, we are required to extend our complete trust to a judge.
So you split the judge into two people. A crime committed in his leisure time...
I'll shout it in the city squares... "Judge Cunning is a criminal!"
-"And a judge of the High Court!"
- Yes... - Judge Cunning?
It will be difficult to legally access the judge.
What do you think of your guardian? The judge in the High Court...Edward Cunning
The judge had his ward's properties sold at auction...
Suppose...just suppose that the judge IS a swindler and a fraud.
What's the matter?...You in custody in place of the judge! What the hell more can you expect?
Get Judge Cunning for me. Immediately! Say it's most important.
Who...? The Judge as you well know!
Judge Cunning?
Thank you, now you can leave me alone with the judge for a while.
The roles are reversed Judge Cunning.
the foremost men in our judicial system... High Court Judge Edvard Cunning
Half time...2-0 to the judge eh?
...like The Judge.
It was The Judge in you.
Are you aware of the articles about Judge Cunning that the paper published?
Can you see here in the courtroom your former guardian Judge Cunning?
High Court Judge Edvard Cunning.
Judge Cunning will be a witness against himself.
Only a judge could be so blind.
And you Mr Judge...what are you?
That's also Judge Cunning.
